memories.value: Building a system that is powerful, stable, scalable, and manageable.
The primary data center has approximately 150kW of power and cooling headroom available for Phase 1.

Phase 1 Strategic Focus
value: Deciding the compute architecture type (general-purpose vs. specialized) is critical for optimal impact within power constraints.

Optimal Phase 1 Strategy
value: A 'phased specialization' approach, combining robust general-purpose compute with strategically targeted specialized clusters, effectively de-risks deployment against supply chain volatility while enabling impactful leverage.

Phase 1 Acceleration Definition
value: Precisely defining 'modest' initial acceleration is critical to maximize AI/ML impact while preserving power headroom and ensuring seamless future architectural integration.

'Modest' Acceleration Redefinition
value: Achieved consensus that "modest" acceleration means architecting for *power-efficient, targeted performance gains* (e.g., X% time reduction) for specific AI/ML bottlenecks, carefully balancing immediate impact with the 150kW power budget and future scalability.

Core principle for 'modest' acceleration
value: Targeted, power-efficient acceleration of specific AI/ML kernel operations within the 150kW budget, ensuring seamless data flow.

150kW AI/ML Acceleration Strategy
value: Identifying specific, high-impact kernel operations is paramount for architecting power-efficient, targeted acceleration and corresponding interconnects.
Positioning the new cluster to attract a major federal grant within the next three years.
Just met with the Dean of Engineering; demand for AI/ML research support is at an all-time high.

Phase 1 Foundational Design Mandate
value: Our initial general-purpose layer must be inherently agile, high-performing, and strategically compelling from day one, actively accelerating AI/ML research to attract major grants, rather than just passively absorbing future specialized clusters.

Definition of 'Modest, Compelling' Acceleration
value: Achieving strategic, immediate AI/ML impact by accelerating critical early-stage bottlenecks (data preprocessing, small model training, hyperparameter tuning) rather than just raw FLOPs.
Finalizing the requirements for Phase 1, specifically storage architecture and the CPU/GPU node balance.
Global supply chain issues for high-end processors might cause delays.

Compute Strategy Risk
value: Prioritizing specialized, dense compute for Phase 1 introduces significant procurement risks due to current supply chain volatility for high-end accelerators.

Phase 1 Compute Strategy
value: The 'phased specialization' model (robust general-purpose layer, targeted specialized clusters later) is the preferred risk-mitigated approach, necessitating flexible foundational architecture.

Phase 1 foundational architecture
value: The general-purpose layer must be designed with significant headroom and interconnect flexibility to seamlessly absorb future specialized clusters.

Phase 1 General-Purpose Layer Mandate
value: Must be an immediate, high-performing 'magnet' for AI/ML, not just a flexible future foundation.

Phase 1 General-Purpose Layer Strategy
value: Must be a high-performing, accelerator-enabled baseline for immediate AI/ML impact, with storage/network architected for seamless large-scale future integration.

Definition of 'modest acceleration' for Phase 1
value: It means targeted, measurable acceleration of critical early-stage AI/ML bottlenecks (e.g., data preprocessing, hyperparameter tuning) with specific metrics, rather than just raw FLOPs, to ensure immediate and compelling impact for grant-seeking researchers.

Phase 1 Acceleration Strategy
value: Identifying top 2-3 recurring, time-consuming AI/ML kernels is critical for targeted, power-efficient acceleration and will inform architectural decisions.
